info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.discovery
info.description:
Service discovery in F5XC performs following

Dynamic service discovery: Resolving the load balancer endpoints for a ADC cluster
Dynamic VIP discovery: Publishing virtual IP to attract traffic from clients

post.description: API to create discovery object for a site or virtual site in system namespace

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: metadata.namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "staging"
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

put.description: API to replace discovery object for a site or virtual site in system namespace

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: metadata.namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "staging"
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

parameters.name: metadata.name
parameters.description:
name

x-example: "acmecorp-web"
The configuration object to be replaced will be looked up by name

post.description:
Download the cerificates files for the Log Collerctor
In order to establish connection from the third party application server to the
Log Colletor the user should download a zip file with the certificates files:
- client.crt
- client.key
- server_ca.crt

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

get.description: API to Get discovery object for a site or virtual site in system namespace

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "ns1"
The namespace in which the configuration object is present

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
name

x-example: "name"
The name of the configuration object to be fetched

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description:
The format in which the configuration object is to be fetched. This could be for example
    - in GetSpec form for the contents of object
    - in CreateRequest form to create a new similar object
    - to ReplaceRequest form to replace changeable values

Default format of returned resource
Response should be in CreateRequest format
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
Response should have other objects referring to this object
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object

Example: ` "10.1.1.1"`

servers will be discovered under shared namespace.

discoveryDownloadCertificatesResponse.description:
Response to the DownloadCertificatesResponse
A zip file with the certificates files:
- client.crt
- client.key
- server_ca.crt
discoveryDownloadCertificatesResponse.title: DownloadCertificatesResponse

data.description:
data is base64 encoded value of certificate in PKCS12 format.

Example: ` "value"`
data.title: Data

discoveryGetResponse.description: This is the output message of the 'Get' RPC
discoveryGetResponse.title: GetResponse is the shape of a read discovery

deleted_referred_objects.description: The set of deleted objects that are referred by this object
deleted_referred_objects.title: deleted_referred_objects

disabled_referred_objects.description: The set of deleted objects that are referred by this object
disabled_referred_objects.title: disabled_referred_objects

referring_objects.description: The set of objects that are referring to this object in their spec
referring_objects.title: referring_objects

status.description: The status reported by different services for this configuration object
status.title: status

discoveryGetResponseFormatCode.description:
x-displayName: "Get Response Format"
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the GetResponse

 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_DEFAULT: x-displayName: "Default Format"
Default format of returned resource
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_CREATE: x-displayName: "Create request Format"
Response should be in CreateRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_REPLACE: x-displayName: "Replace request format"
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_STATUS: x-displayName: "Status format"
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_READ: x-displayName: "GetSpecType format"
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_REFERRING_OBJECTS: x-displayName: "Referring Objects"
Response should have other objects referring to this object
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_BROKEN_REFERENCES: x-displayName: "Broken Referred Objects"
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object
discoveryGetResponseFormatCode.title: GetResponseFormatCode

discoveryGetSpecType.description: API to Get discovery object for a site or virtual site in system namespace
discoveryGetSpecType.title: Get discovery

cluster_id.description:
Exclusive with [no_cluster_id]
 Specify identifier for discovery cluster. This identifier can be
 specified in endpoint object to discover only from this discovery object.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256

discoveryK8SDNSMode.description:
Two modes are possible

CoreDNS: Whether external K8s cluster is running core-dns
KubeDNS: External K8s cluster is running kube-dns
discoveryK8SDNSMode.title: K8SDNSMode

subdomain.description:
The DNS subdomain for which F5XC will respond to DNS queries.

Example: ` "value"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
subdomain.title: subdomain

discoveryK8SNamespaceMapping.description: Select the mapping between K8s namespaces from which services will be discovered and App Namespace to which the discovered services will be shared.
discoveryK8SNamespaceMapping.title: K8S Namespace Mapping

items.description:
Map K8s namespace(s) to App Namespaces. In Shared Configuration, Discovered Services can only be mapped to a single App Namespace, which is determined by the first matched regex.

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 32
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.min_items: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
items.title: K8S Namespace to App Namespace Mapping

discoveryK8SNamespaceMappingItem.description:
Map K8s Namespace(s) to an App Namespace. If not specified, all virtual
servers will be discovered under shared namespace.
discoveryK8SNamespaceMappingItem.title: K8S Namespace Mapping Item

namespace_regex.description:
The regex here will be used to match K8s namespace(s).

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.regex: true
namespace_regex.title: Kubernetes Namespace Regex

namespace.description:
The namespace where the service/endpoints need to be created if it's not included in the domain.
 The external K8S administrator needs to ensure that the namespace exists.

Example: ` "default"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64
namespace.title: namespace

discoveryListResponse.title: ListResponse is the collection of discovery

errors.description: Errors(if any) while listing items from collection
errors.title: errors

items.description: items represents the collection in response
items.title: items

By default a summary of discovery is returned in 'List'. By setting
'report_fields' in the ListRequest more details of each item can be got.
discoveryListResponseItem.title: ListResponseItem is an individual item in a collection of discovery

annotations.description: The set of annotations present on this discovery
annotations.title: annotations

description.description: The description set for this discovery
description.title: description

disabled.description: A value of true indicates discovery is administratively disabled
disabled.title: disabled

labels.title: labels

The name of this discovery

Example: ` "name"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
The namespace this item belongs to

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

status_set.description: The status reported by different services for this configuration object
status_set.title: status

tenant.description:
The tenant this item belongs to

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
The unique uid of this discovery

Example: ` "d27938ba-967e-40a7-9709-57b8627f9f75"`
uid.title: uid

port.description:
x-displayName: "Management Port"
x-example: "443"
Management Port of the BIGIP HA cluster
port.title: Management Port

discoveryNamespaceMapping.description:
x-displayName: "Namespace Mapping"
Select the mapping between BIG-IP partition from which services will be discovered and App Namespace to which the discovered services will be shared.
discoveryNamespaceMapping.title: Namespace Mapping

x-displayName: "Partition to Namespace Mapping"
x-required
Map BIG-IP partition(s) to App Namespaces

x-displayName: "Namespace Mapping Item"
Map BIG-IP partition(s) to an App Namespace. If not specified, all virtual
servers will be discovered under shared namespace.
discoveryNamespaceMappingItem.title: Namespace Mapping Item

partition_regex.description:
x-displayName: "Regex To Match BIG-IP device partition(s)"
The regex here will be used to match BIG-IP partition(s).
partition_regex.title: Classic BIG-IP Partition Regex

discoveryPodInfoType.description: Information about POD providing the service
discoveryPodInfoType.title: Pod info

ip.description:
IP Address of the POD

Example: ` "192.1.2.3"`
ip.title: IP Address

discoveryPortInfoType.title: Port information

port.description:
Port number on which the service is exposed

Example: ` "8080"`

Required: YES

  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 65535

protocol.description:
Protocol on which the service is exposed

Example: ` "TCP"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
protocol.title: Protocol

target_port.description:
Port on which the pods targeted by the service can be reached.
 TargetPort of Kubernetes service when its type is ClusterIP.
 NodePort of Kubernetes service when its type is NodePort.

Example: ` "8081"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 65535
target_port.title: Target Port

discoveryReplaceRequest.title: ReplaceRequest is used to replace contents of a discovery

discoveryReplaceSpecType.title: Replace discovery

cluster_id.description:
Exclusive with [no_cluster_id]
 Specify identifier for discovery cluster. This identifier can be
 specified in endpoint object to discover only from this discovery object.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256

discoveryRestConfigType.description: Configuration details to access discovery service rest API.
discoveryRestConfigType.title: REST API config

api_server.description:
API server must be a fully qualified domain string and port specified as host:port pair

Example: ` "api.acme.com:4430"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.hostport: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 262
api_server.title: Discovery Service API server

discoverySchemeType.description:
x-displayName: "Scheme"
Scheme to use when doing REST API to discovery server

 - HTTP: x-displayName: "HTTP"
http:// Scheme
 - HTTPS: x-displayName: "HTTPS"
https:// Scheme
discoverySchemeType.title: REST scheme

discoveryStatusObject.description: Most recently observed status of object
discoveryStatusObject.title: Discovery Status Object

discoveryTLSClientConfigType.description: TLS config for client of discovery service
discoveryTLSClientConfigType.title: TLS config

certificate.description:
Client  certificate is PEM-encoded certificate or certificate-chain.

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true

server_name.description:
ServerName is passed to the server for SNI and is used in the client to check server
 certificates against. If ServerName is empty, the hostname used to contact the
 server is used

Example: ` "k8s.acme.com"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.hostname: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
server_name.title: Server Name

trusted_ca_url.description:
The URL or value for trusted Server CA certificate or certificate chain
 Certificates in PEM format including the PEM headers.

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
trusted_ca_url.title: Server CA certificates

discoveryThirdPartyDiscoveryType.description:
x-displayName: "Discovery"
Configure third party log source applications to send logs to your XC environment. Define application names and allowed IP ranges using CIDR notation.
See Tech Docs for details setup instractions.
discoveryThirdPartyDiscoveryType.title: Third Party Application

applications.description:
x-required
x-displayName: "Application Source Name"
Defines names to identify and distingish log source system or platforms
applications.title: Third Party Application

expiration_timestamp.description:
x-displayName: "Expiration Time"
This discovery service expiration timestamp
expiration_timestamp.title: expiration_timestamp

source_cidr.description:
x-required
x-displayName: "Source Subnet IP"
x-example: "1.1.1.0/24 or 2001:10/64"
Source IP of the packet to match
source_cidr.title: source IP

discoveryVerStatusType.description: This VER status is per site on which discovery is happening and it lists all services that site has discovered.
discoveryVerStatusType.title: VER status for k8s and consul Discovery

connected.description: Indicates connection status to external discovery service
connected.title: Connection status

site.description: Name of the site that reported this status
site.title: Origin site

discoveryVipDiscoveryInfoType.description:
x-displayName: "VIP Publish Configuration"
K8S Configuration to publish VIPs
discoveryVipDiscoveryInfoType.title: VIP Discovery Info Type

namespace.description:
x-displayName: "Default Namespace"
When virtual IP is published with "PUBLISH_SERVICE" mode, this field indicates the namespace
where the service/endpoints needs to be created if the domain name doesn't specify it
explicitly. K8S administrator of the external K8s should ensure this namespace is created
namespace.title: default namespace

publish_virtual_ip.description:
x-displayName: "VIP Publish Enable"
Are we publishing Virtual Host domains to Virtual IP mapping to external cluster
publish_virtual_ip.title: enable/disable publish VIP

subdomain.description:
x-displayName: "Subdomain"
Subdomain for which DNS delegation is done
F5XC Edge Router will only respond for DNS queries on this sub-domain
While programming the DNS DELEGATE on external cluster, VER will take ownership of this
sub-domain
subdomain.title: DNS delegation sub-domain

discoveryVirtualIPDiscoveryType.description:
x-displayName: "Virtual IP Discovery"
How is the Virtual IP discovery done
Two modes are possible
  DNS_DELEGATION: Program DNS delegation for a sub-domain in external K8s cluster
  PUBLISH_SERVICE: Create/Register a service in external K8s/consul cluster

 - DNS_DELEGATION: x-displayName: "DNS Delegation"
DNS sub domain is delegated to volterra site.
 - PUBLISH_SERVICE: x-displayName: "Publish"
Name to VIP mapping is published in external discovery service
discoveryVirtualIPDiscoveryType.title: VirtualIPDiscoveryType

discoveryVirtualServerFilter.description:
x-displayName: "Virtual Server Filter"
Filters to discover only required BIG-IP Virtual Servers. The Virtual Server will be discovered only if it matches all criteria specified below. A blank criteria will be treated as match all.
discoveryVirtualServerFilter.title: Virtual Server Filter

description_regex.description:
x-displayName: "Regex To Match Virtual Server Description"
Regex to match Virtual Server description
description_regex.title: Regex To Match Virtual Server Description

discover_disabled_virtual_servers.description:
x-displayName: "Discover Disabled Virtual Servers"
When checked, disabled virtual servers will be included
discover_disabled_virtual_servers.title: Discover Disabled Virtual Servers

name_regex.description:
x-displayName: "Regex To Match Virtual Server Name"
Regex to match Virtual Server name
name_regex.title: Regex To Match Virtual Server Name

port_ranges.description:
x-displayName: "Port Ranges"
x-example: "80,443,8080-8191,9080"
A string containing a comma separated list of individual service ports or port ranges.
Each port range consists of a single port or two ports separated by "-". For example, 8000-8191.
Maximum number of ports allowed is 1024.
port_ranges.title: Port_ranges

ioschemaEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
ioschemaEmpty.title: Empty

ioschemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
ioschemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`

When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)

uid.title: uid

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.title: BlindfoldSecretInfoType

Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Secret Management service.

Location is the uri_ref. It could be in url format for string:///
 Or it could be a path if the store provider is an http/https location

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true

 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

schemaClearSecretInfoType.title: ClearSecretInfoType

provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "box-provider"`
provider.title: Provider

url.description:
URL of the secret. Currently supported URL schemes is string:///.
 For string:/// scheme, Secret needs to be encoded Base64 format.
 When asked for this secret, caller will get Secret bytes after Base64 decoding.

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status
hostname.title: hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated
last_update_time.title: last_update_time

reason.description:
x-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
 A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status
service_name.title: service name

status.description:
Status of the condition
 "Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
 "Failed"  Validation has failed.
 "Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
 "Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
 "Down" Configuration is operationally down. e.g. down interface
 "Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. ObjectMetaType.Disable = true.
 "NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs

Example: ` "Failed"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Success\",\"Failed\",\"Incomplete\",\"Installed\",\"Down\",\"Disabled\",\"NotApplicable\"]
status.title: status

type.description:
Type of the condition
 "Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
 "Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object

Example: ` "Operational"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Validation\",\"Operational\"]
type.title: type

schemaDiscoveryType.description:
Specifies whether the discovery is from Kubernetes or Consul cluster

Invalid Discovery mechanism
Discover from Kubernetes cluster
Discover from Consul service
Discover from Classic BIG-IP Clusters
Discover for Third Party Application
schemaDiscoveryType.title: DiscoveryType

schemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

 - EOK: No error
 - EPERMS: Permissions error
 - EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
 - ENOTFOUND: Not found
 - EEXISTS: Already exists
 - EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
 - ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
 - EINTERNAL: Server error
 - EPARTIAL: Partial error
schemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description:
A human readable string of the error

Example: ` "value"`
message.title: message

schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.
pending.title: pending

schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
 for latest status object from same origin
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
 This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.

Example: ` "ver.re1.int.ves.io"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
 identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
 information

Example: ` "ver-instance-1"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

status_id.description:
status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
 objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
 daemon(creator-id)
status_id.title: status_id

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

 - STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
 - STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.description:
SystemObjectGetMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.title: SystemObjectGetMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

A virtual_site direct reference

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 1
ref.title: ref

Key of the individual secret. Vault Secrets are stored as key-value pair.
If user is only interested in one value from the map, this field should be set to the corresponding key.
If not provided entire secret will be returned.

x-required

Path to secret in Vault.

x-required

Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Vault.

If not provided latest version will be returned.

schemaVirtualNetworkType.description:
Different types of virtual networks understood by the system

Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL provides connectivity to public (outside) network.
This is an insecure network and is connected to public internet via NAT Gateways/firwalls
Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different
sites are neither related nor connected.

Constraints:
There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site.
This network type is supported on CE sites. This network is created automatically and present on all sites
Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL_INSIDE is a private network inside site.
It is a secure network and is not connected to public network.
Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different
sites are neither related nor connected.

Constraints:
There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site.
This network type is supported on CE sites. This network is created during provisioning of site
User defined per-site virtual network. Scope of this virtual network is limited to the site.
This is not yet supported
Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_PUBLIC directly conects to the public internet.
Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different sites are neither related nor connected.

Constraints:
There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site.
This network type is supported on RE sites only
It is an internally created by the system. They must not be created by user
Virtual Neworks with global scope across different sites in F5XC domain.
An example global virtual-network called "AIN Network" is created for every tenant.
for volterra fabric

Constraints:
It is currently only supported as internally created by the system.
vK8s service network for a given tenant. Used to advertise a virtual host only to vk8s pods for that tenant
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
VER internal network for the site. It can only be used for virtual hosts with SMA_PROXY type proxy
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL_INSIDE_OUTSIDE represents both
VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL and VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL_INSIDE

Constraints:
This network type is only meaningful in an advertise policy
When virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_IP_AUTO is selected for
an endpoint, VER will try to determine the network based on the provided
IP address

Constraints:
This network type is only meaningful in an endpoint

VoltADN Private Network is used on volterra RE(s) to connect to customer private networks
This network is created by opening a support ticket

This network is per site srv6 network
VER IP Fabric network for the site.
This Virtual network type is used for exposing virtual host on IP Fabric network on the VER site or
for endpoint in IP Fabric network
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
Network internally created for a segment
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
schemaVirtualNetworkType.title: VirtualNetworkType
